title: Canva
content:

So it's shifting employees into new roles |work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] |last1=Burton |first1=Amber |last2=Confino |first2=Palo |date=24 March 2023 |archive-url=http://archive.today/2023.03.24-122911/https://fortune.com/2023/03/24/canva-internal-mobility-layoffs-upskilling/ |archive-date=24 March 2023 |url-status=live}}</ref>

language|Wolof]], [[Xhosa language|Xhosa]], [[Yoruba language|Yoruba]] and [[Zulu language|Zulu]]

'''Canva''' is an online [[graphic design]] platform that is used to create [[social media]] graphics and [[presentations]].<ref name=techcrunch2>{{cite news |author=Perez, Sarah |url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/08/26/backed-by-3-million-in-funding-canva-launches-a-graphic-design-platform-anyone-can-use/ |title=Canva Launches A Graphic Design Platform Anyone Can Use |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190902223751/https://techcrunch.com/2013/08/26/backed-by-3-million-in-funding-canva-launches-a-graphic-design-platform-anyone-can-use/ |archive-date=2 September 2019 |work=Tech Crunch' |date=26 August 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author1=Lancet, Yaara |author2=Zukerman, Erez |url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/2079100/canva-review-free-tool-brings-much-needed-simplicity-to-design-process.html |title=Canva review: Free tool brings much-needed simplicity to design process |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141221134956/http://www.pcworld.com/article/2079100/canva-review-free-tool-brings-much-needed-simplicity-to-design-process.html |archive-date=21 December 2014 |work=[[PC World]] |date=7 January 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Swallow, Erica |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/ericaswallow/2013/11/18/canva/ |title=Canva Makes Great Design More Accessible |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180816162211/https://www.forbes.com/sites/ericaswallow/2013/11/18/canva/ |archive-date=16 August 2018 |work=[[Forbes]] |date=18 November 2013 }}</ref>

The company has announced it intends to compete with Google and Microsoft in the [[office software]] category with website and [[Whiteboarding|whiteboard]] products.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |last=Bonyhady |first=Nick |date=2022-09-14 |title=Canva to go up against Microsoft and Google |url=https://www.smh.com.au/business/companies/canva-to-go-up-against-microsoft-and-google-20220914-p5bhy6.html |access-date=2022-09-27 |website=The Sydney Morning Herald |language=en}}</ref>
==History==
Canva was founded in [[Perth]], Australia, by [[Melanie Perkins]], [[Cliff Obrecht]], [[Buebe Lamaz]] and Cameron Adams on 1 January 2013. In its first year, Canva had more than 750,000 users.<ref name=rebekah>{{cite news|url=http://boss.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/09/15/the-problem-with-going-into-business-with-a-friend/ |title=The Problem With Going Into Business With a Friend |first=Rebekah|last=Campbell|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=15 September 2014|access-date=21 December 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141221133546/http://boss.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/09/15/the-problem-with-going-into-business-with-a-friend/ |archive-date=21 December 2014|url-status=live}}</ref> In April 2014, [[social media]] and technology expert [[Guy Kawasaki]] joined the company as its chief [[Evangelism marketing|evangelist]] (brand promoter).<ref name=techcrunch3>{{Cite web|last=Mishra|first=Pankaj|date=2014-04-16|title=Guy Kawasaki Joins Australian Design Startup Canva As Chief Evangelist|url=https://techcrunch.com/2014/04/16/guy-kawasaki-joins-australian-design-startup-canva-as-chief-evangelist/|access-date=2022-12-27|website=TechCrunch|language=en-US}}</ref> In 2015, ''Canva for Work'' was launched, focusing on marketing materials.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.fastcompany.com/40514362/graphic-design-startup-canva-just-turned-into-a-unicorn|title=Graphic design startup Canva just turned into a unicorn|date=2018-01-08|work=Fast Company|access-date=2018-06-27|language=en-US|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180627230754/https://www.fastcompany.com/40514362/graphic-design-startup-canva-just-turned-into-a-unicorn|archive-date=27 June 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>

During the 2016-17 financial year, Canva's revenue increased from {{AUD|6.8 million}} to {{AUD|23.5 million}}, with a loss of {{AUD|3.3 million}}. In 2017, the company reached profitability and had 294,000 paying customers.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://techcrunch.com/2018/01/08/new-sequoia-china-investment-values-australian-design-company-canva-at-1-billion/|title=New Sequoia China investment values Australian design company Canva at $1 billion – TechCrunch|website=techcrunch.com|date=8 January 2018 |language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-27|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180627230946/https://techcrunch.com/2018/01/08/new-sequoia-china-investment-values-australian-design-company-canva-at-1-billion/|archive-date=27 June 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>

In January 2018, Perkins announced that the company had raised {{AUD|40 million}} from [[Sequoia Capital]], Blackbird Ventures, and Felicis Ventures, and the company was valued at {{AUD|1 billion}}.<ref name=bbc20180109>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/business-42552367|title=The 30-year-old woman who designed a $1bn business|first1=Kate|last1=Stanton|first2=Hywel|last2=Griffith|date=2018-01-09|access-date=2018-01-09|work=[[BBC News]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180728132608/https://www.bbc.com/news/business-42552367|archive-date=28 July 2018|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=abc20180109>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-01-09/canva-australian-unicorn-1-billion-valuation/9312458|title=Canva: Online design startup joins generally overvalued 'unicorn' club|first1=David|last1=Chau|date=2018-01-09|access-date=2018-01-09|work=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]]|location=Australia|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180112003453/http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-01-09/canva-australian-unicorn-1-billion-valuation/9312458|archive-date=12 January 2018|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=":0" /> Australian superannuation funds [[Hostplus]] and [[Aware Super]] are known to be investors.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web |date=2022-07-26 |title=Blackbird reveals Canva's $14b plunge in value |url=https://www.afr.com/chanticleer/blackbird-reveals-canva-s-14b-plunge-in-value-20220726-p5b4k7 |access-date=2023-01-24 |website=Australian Financial Review |language=en}}</ref>

During May 2019, the company raised another round of funding of {{AUD}}70 million from [[General Catalyst]] and Bond and its existing investors Blackbird Ventures and Felicis Ventures, valuing Canva at {{AUD}}2.5 billion.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Clark |first1=Kate |title=Graphic design platform Canva valued at $2.5B with new funds |url=https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/20/graphic-design-platform-canva-valued-at-2-5b-with-new-funds/ |website=TechCrunch |date=20 May 2019 |access-date=2 July 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190627005813/https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/20/graphic-design-platform-canva-valued-at-2-5b-with-new-funds/ |archive-date=27 June 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref> In October of that year, Canva announced that it had raised an additional {{AUD}}85 million at a valuation of {{AUD}}3.2 billion and launched an enterprise product.<ref name="tc">{{cite web |last1=Cook |first1=Jordan |date=16 October 2019 |title=Canva, now valued at $3.2 billion, launches an enterprise product |url=https://techcrunch.com/2019/10/16/canva-now-valued-at-3-2-billion-launches-an-enterprise-product/ |access-date=6 February 2020 |website=TechCrunch |ref=tc}}</ref>

In December 2019, Canva announced ''Canva for Education'', a free product for [[school]]s and other educational institutions intended to facilitate collaboration between students and teachers.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hennessy |first1=James |date=6 December 2019 |title=Canva has announced a slew of new products, including a video editing tool and an education offering |language=en |work=Business Insider Australia |url=https://www.businessinsider.com.au/canva-new-products-canva-video-apps-2019-12 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200301044950/https://www.businessinsider.com.au/canva-new-products-canva-video-apps-2019-12 |archive-date=1 March 2020}}</ref>

In June 2020, Canva announced a partnership with [[FedEx Office]]<ref>{{Cite news|last=Crook|first=Jordan|date=June 17, 2020|title=Canva design platform partners with FedEx Office as it pushes further into the US|work=TechCrunch|url=https://techcrunch.com/2020/06/16/canva-design-platform-partners-with-fedex-office-as-it-pushes-further-into-the-u-s/}}</ref> and with [[Office Depot]] the following month.<ref>{{Cite news|date=16 July 2020|title=Office Depot Enhances Print Services Portfolio with New Graphic Design Solutions Powered by Canva|work=Bloomberg|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/press-releases/2020-07-16/office-depot-enhances-print-services-portfolio-with-new-graphic-design-solutions-powered-by-canva}}</ref> {{As of|2020|06}}, Canva's valuation had risen to {{AUD}}6 billion, rising to A$40 billion by September 2021.<ref>{{Cite news |last1=Tse |first1=Crystal |last2=Roof |first2=Katie |last3=Tan |first3=Gillian |last4=Lee |first4=Yoolim |date=22 June 2020 |title=Australia's Canva Startup Almost Doubles Valuation to $6 Billion |work=Bloomberg |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-22/australia-s-canva-raises-60-million-at-6-billion-value}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=16 September 2021 |title=Canva: Australian online design platform valued at $40bn |work=BBC |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-58567722 |access-date=20 September 2021}}</ref> In September 2021, Canva raised US$200 million, with its value peaking that year at US$40 billion.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Konrad |first=Alex |title=Canva Raises At $40 Billion Valuation — Its Founders Are Pledging Away Most Of Their Wealth |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexkonrad/2021/09/14/canva-raises-at-40-billion-valuation-and-founders-pledge-away-their-wealth/ |access-date=2021-09-19 |website=Forbes |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=2021-09-15 |title=Canva: Australian online design platform valued at $40bn |language=en-GB |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-58567722 |access-date=2022-01-13}}</ref> By September 2022, the valuation of the company had leveled at US$26 billion.<ref name=":2" /> While its value had fallen significantly, perhaps as much as 35% from its 2021 high to mid 2022, it was still known as a "darling" of the Australian tech sector, along with [[Atlassian]].<ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite web |last=Yun |first=Jessica |date=2023-01-17 |title='Orange is the new Palo Alto': Why the next Atlassian, Canva will be from the bush |url=https://www.smh.com.au/business/entrepreneurship/orange-is-the-new-palo-alto-why-the-next-atlassian-canva-will-be-from-the-bush-20230117-p5cd50.html |access-date=2023-01-24 |website=The Sydney Morning Herald |language=en}}</ref> In March 2022, Canva had over 75 million monthly active users.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Aziz |first=Afdhel |title=How Canva Is Being A Force For Good By Empowering The Whole World To Design |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/afdhelaziz/2022/03/31/how-canva-is-being-a-force-for-good-by-empowering-the-whole-world-to-design/ |access-date=2023-11-14 |website=Forbes |language=en}}</ref>  

Co-founders Perkins and Obrecht have already disclosed their plan to give away much of their fortune to numerous philanthropic causes.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-09-14|title=Canva founders to give $16.5b fortune away|url=https://www.afr.com/technology/canva-doubles-to-55b-valuation-after-fresh-raise-20210915-p58rq3|access-date=2021-09-19|website=Australian Financial Review|language=en}}</ref> In 2023, the pair were named in the [[Australian Financial Review]]'s AFR Rich List as among the 10 most wealthy people in Australia.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-05-24 |title=The 200 richest people in Australia revealed |url=https://www.afr.com/rich-list/australia-s-10-richest-people-revealed-20230523-p5dapa |access-date=2023-09-25 |website=Australian Financial Review |language=en}}</ref>

On December 7, 2022, Canva launched Magic Write, which is the platform’s AI-powered copywriting assistant.<ref>{{Cite web |title=AI text generation is moving mainstream with Canva's Magic Write |url=https://www.pcworld.com/article/1424421/ai-text-generation-is-moving-mainstream.html |access-date=2023-04-13 |website=PCWorld |language=en}}</ref> On March 22, 2023, Canva announced its new Assistant tool, which makes recommendations on graphics and styles that match the user's existing design.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Malik |first=Aisha |date=2023-03-23 |title=Canva unveils a series of new features, including several AI-powered tools |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/03/22/canva-new-features-including-suite-of-ai-powered-tools/ |access-date=2023-04-13 |website=TechCrunch |language=en-US}}</ref>

===Data breach===
In May 2019, Canva experienced a [[data breach]] in which the data of roughly 139 million users was hacked.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.zdnet.com/article/australian-tech-unicorn-canva-suffers-security-breach/|title=Australian tech unicorn Canva suffers security breach|website=ZDNet|language=en|access-date=2019-12-07}}</ref> The exposed data included real names of users, usernames, email addresses, geographical information, and password hashes for some users.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.tomsguide.com/us/canva-data-breach,news-30165.html|title=139 Million Users Hit in Canva Data Breach|website=Tom's Guide|date=24 May 2019|language=en|access-date=2019-12-07}}</ref> Canva faced criticism for an initial email to customers, which buried the details below self-congratulatory marketing content.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Smith |first1=Paul |title=Canva criticised after data breach exposed 139m user details |url=https://www.afr.com/technology/canva-criticised-after-data-breach-exposed-139m-user-details-20190526-p51r8i#:~:text=High%20profile%20Australian%20technology%20company,its%20valuation%20soar%20to%20%24US2./ |access-date=5 September 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Palmer-Derrin|first1=Stephanie|title="Marketing fluff": What startups can learn from Canva's data-breach response|url=https://www.smartcompany.com.au/startupsmart/analysis/canva-data-breach-response/|access-date=5 September 2020}}</ref> Later in January 2020, approximately 4 million user passwords were decrypted and shared online.<ref>{{cite web |date=17 January 2020 |title=Canva Security Incident – May 24 FAQs |url=https://www.canva.com/help/incident-may24/ |url-status= |access-date=16 August 2022 |website=Canva}}</ref> Canva responded by resetting the passwords of every user who had not changed their password since the initial breach.

===Acquisitions===
In 2018, the company acquired presentations startup Zeetings for an undisclosed amount, as part of its expansion into the presentations space.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Powell |first1=Dominic |title=SmartCompany |url=https://www.smartcompany.com.au/startupsmart/news/canva-makes-first-acquisition-of-presentations-startup-zeetings-to-end-death-by-powerpoint/ |access-date=6 February 2020}}</ref>

In May 2019, the company announced the acquisitions of [[Pixabay]] and [[Pexels]], two free [[stock photography]] sites based in Germany, which enabled Canva users to access their photos for designs.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Jonathan |first1=Shieber |title=Australia's design unicorn, Canva, picks up two free image-sharing services, and launches new photo product |url=https://techcrunch.com/2019/05/17/australias-design-unicorn-canva-picks-up-two-free-image-sharing-services-and-launches-new-photo-product/ |website=TechCrunch |date=17 May 2019 |access-date=10 December 2019}}</ref>

In February 2021, Canva acquired Austrian startup Kaleido.ai and the Czech-based Smartmockups.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|last=Lee|first=Yoolim|date=2021-02-22|title=Australia's Canva Buys European Design Startups to Fuel Growth|language=en|work=Bloomberg.com|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-22/australia-s-canva-buys-european-design-startups-to-fuel-growth|url-status=live|access-date=2021-02-23|archive-url=https://archive.today/20210222185942/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-22/australia-s-canva-buys-european-design-startups-to-fuel-growth|archive-date=22 February 2021}}</ref>

* [[Adobe Express]]

<ref name=onstartups>{{Cite web|title=How Emotion Helped Grow Our Startup to 2.8M Users in 20 Months|url=https://www.onstartups.com/canva-user-journey|access-date=2022-12-27|website=www.onstartups.com|language=en-us}}</ref>

<ref name=startupdaily>{{Cite web|last=Beeche|first=Mat|date=2014-07-02|title=Guy Kawasaki on why he wanted to work with Canva|url=https://www.startupdaily.net/advice/guy-kawasaki-wanted-work-canva/|access-date=2022-12-27|website=Startup Daily|language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref name=techcrunch1>{{Cite web|last=Perez|first=Sarah|date=2013-03-19|title=Canva Raises $3 Million To Make Design Accessible To Everyone|url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/03/19/canva-raises-3-million-to-make-design-accessible-to-everyone/|access-date=2022-12-27|website=TechCrunch|language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref name=techcrunch4>{{Cite web|last=Shu|first=Catherine|date=2014-07-21|title=Australian Graphic Design Startup Canva Raises Additional $3.6M|url=https://techcrunch.com/2014/07/21/australian-graphic-design-startup-canva-raises-additional-3-6m/|access-date=2022-12-27|website=TechCrunch|language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref name=techcrunch5>{{Cite web|last=Perez|first=Sarah|date=2014-10-15|title=Canva Brings Its Easy-To-Use Design Platform To The iPad|url=https://techcrunch.com/2014/10/15/canva-brings-its-easy-to-use-design-platform-to-the-ipad/|access-date=2022-12-27|website=TechCrunch|language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref name=techcrunch7>{{Cite web|last=Perez|first=Sarah|date=2015-05-04|title=Design Platform Canva Raises $6 Million, Expands To Businesses With "Canva For Work"|url=https://techcrunch.com/2015/05/04/design-platform-canva-raises-6-million-expands-to-businesses-with-canva-for-work/|access-date=2022-12-27|website=TechCrunch|language=en-US}}</ref>
